intro: Jussiaea epilobioides var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered willowherb, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, often pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils along stream banks and in wet meadows. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered with fine hairs, while the flowers are clustered in spikes. It is an important species for pollinators and is often found in wetland habitats.
